name: suicidally
content:
suicidally adverb
(death)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that relates to a person killing themselves intentionally: She was suicidally depressed and eventually killed herself. A man was wandering barefoot along the railway tracks, perhaps suicidally.
More examplesFewer examplesThe pain left her suicideally depressed.Some rebels threw themselves suicidally at their guns.Paltrow gives a rather moving performance as the suicidally inclined Sylvia Plath.

suicidally adverb
(defeat)
in a way that has the effect of causing your own defeat or failure: How could you be so suicidally stupid? The play is about how society separated itself suicidally from Nature.
More examplesFewer examplesThe tennis player's ground strokes were taken suicidally early.Bravely, some might say suicidally, the England captain stepped up to take the first penalty after extra time had ended 2-2.The price of the service has fallen to a suicidally low level.
